title: Clean rebuild/redeploy with zero functional changes (frontend stabilization)

requirements.summary: Ensure the existing React/TypeScript frontend compiles cleanly and runs without runtime errors, preserving current Lobby/Room behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build completes for both the Motoko backend canister and the React/TypeScript frontend without compilation errors.
The deployed app loads successfully in a browser and displays the Lobby screen when no nickname is set.
After setting a nickname, the Lobby Create Room and Join Room tabs render and are interactive (no disabled state due to build/runtime errors).
No uncaught exceptions appear in the browser console during initial load and basic navigation between Lobby and Room views.

file_operations.description: Remove/adjust unused destructured values from hooks (e.g., unused error objects) to satisfy TypeScript noUnusedLocals/noUnusedParameters build settings while keeping identical runtime behavior for room validation, message loading, and navigation.

Eliminate unused imports and avoid creating unused locals from props destructuring (e.g., keep `nickname` in props type but do not destructure it) so the file compiles without changing send/attach/reply behavior.
Remove unused type imports/locals (e.g., unused MessageId import) to prevent TypeScript compilation failures while keeping message rendering/edit/delete/reply/download logic unchanged.
